title: Trump’s Big Policy Bill Puts U.S. on Perilous Fiscal Path
summary: Among the most expensive pieces of legislation in years, the Republican legislation could reshape the country’s finances for a generation.

title: Zohran Mamdani Wins N.Y.C. Mayoral Primary in Decisive 12-Point Victory
summary: Mr. Mamdani defeated Andrew M. Cuomo in the Democratic primary by a significant margin. He was declared the winner on Tuesday after ranked-choice tabulations were run.

title: How Zohran Mamdani Stunned New York and Won the Primary for Mayor
summary: Mr. Mamdani’s victory upended city politics and reverberated nationally. He relied on a memorable message, charisma and a strong ground game.

title: New Yorkers May Vote on Curbing Council’s Power to Block New Housing
summary: The City Council can block the development of new housing. A panel created by Mayor Eric Adams wants to let voters weigh in on reducing the Council’s power.

title: Under a Drone-Swarmed Sky: Surviving in Eastern Ukraine
summary: Towns and troops long accustomed to merciless bombardment are adjusting to an even denser pattern of attacks.

title: Top Russian General Convicted in High-Profile Corruption Case
summary: Timur Ivanov, a longtime deputy defense minister, was sentenced to 13 years in a penal colony, according to the Russian state news agency Tass.

title: California Rolls Back Its Landmark Environmental Law
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom and state lawmakers scaled back a law that was vilified for its role in California’s housing shortage and homelessness crisis.

title: An Offhand Remark About Gold Bars, Secretly Recorded, Upended His Life
summary: Brent Efron’s “boring” Tinder date wanted to hear all about his work at the Environmental Protection Agency, so Mr. Efron talked. If only he’d seen the hidden camera.

title: Restaurant Review: Acamaya in New Orleans
summary: In her first review as our new critic, Tejal Rao visits Acamaya, where the chef Ana Castro is writing the latest chapter in the city’s rich culinary story.

title: Thought Markets Were Volatile in the First Half? Watch Out.
summary: Stocks have rebounded, but the dollar is in a deep slump. Here’s what could go right (and very wrong) for investors.

title: As Debt Piles Up, Countries See Fiscal Relief as Political Leverage
summary: With developing nations crushed by unaffordable borrowing and Washington on the sidelines, some leaders are brokering debt forgiveness deals.

title: Appeals Court Weighs Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act for Deportations
summary: The case is likely to be the first to reach the Supreme Court on the substantive issue of the president’s invocation of a rarely used wartime law.

title: Steve Bannon’s Battle for the Soul of MAGA
summary: The former White House chief strategist speaks about the threats he sees to the political movement that formed around Donald J. Trump.

title: Israelis Set a Palestinian Village Ablaze in West Bank Attack
summary: The violence last week in Kafr Malik, in the West Bank, comes amid a surge in assaults by Israeli settlers. It also set off a chain of violence in the area.

title: Israel’s Netanyahu Says He Will Meet With Trump Next Week
summary: The Israeli prime minister’s expected visit to the United States comes as the cease-fire with Iran may create new momentum for a truce in Gaza.

title: Ford Foundation’s New Leader Says She’ll Work to Protect Democracy
summary: Heather K. Gerken, the dean of the law school, will run the powerful philanthropy, known for pushing for social justice.

title: Jimmy Swaggart, Passionate Televangelist Ousted by Scandal, Dies at 90
summary: A fire-and-brimstone preacher, he reached millions and made millions in a global enterprise before tumbling from grace over his encounters with a prostitute.

title: How the Hottest Place in India Survives
summary: It’s 40 degrees Celsius (104 Fahrenheit), and it’s only 10 a.m. Welcome to Sri Ganganagar.

title: What to Know About the Heat Wave in Europe
summary: Health warnings were issued to tens of millions of Europeans as temperatures climbed well above 100 degrees Fahrenheit, or more than 40 degrees Celsius.

title: Wimbledon 2025: How the World’s Oldest Tennis Tournament is Coping with the Heat Wave
summary: With 6,700 refillable water bottles, “shade mapping” and ice packs, the world’s oldest championship tennis tournament is taking Britain’s heat wave seriously.

title: My First America
summary: When I was a teenager, a mostly forgotten series of novels taught me U.S. history. How would they read to me now?

title: JD Vance Tells the Truth About the ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’
summary: Vance’s posts about the reconciliation package reveal the true nature of Trump’s populism.

title: Bryan Kohberger, Suspect in Idaho Student Murders, Accepts Plea Deal
summary: Bryan Kohberger, a former criminology student, is charged in the stabbing deaths of four University of Idaho students. Prosecutors said they had reached a plea agreement that avoids the death penalty.

title: The U.S. Sends Lots of Plastic Trash Overseas. Malaysia Just Said No Thanks.
summary: No country receives more discarded plastic from wealthy countries, but shipments from the United States are no longer welcome.

title: With Tillis Out, North Carolina’s Senate Race Will Draw Parties’ Firepower
summary: A popular former Democratic governor, Roy Cooper, is expected to announce a bid this summer. The Republicans are banking on an endorsement by President Trump to clear their field.
